hanzi-su-wiki:
複

Значения

Снова; повторный

Мнемоника

Справа — человек 人, каждый день 日 занятый тяжёлым трудом 夂 в значении «повторный». Одежду 衤 то снимают, то снова одевают.

Варианты

复

repeat, double, overlap
повторить, удвоить, перекрыть

heisig_chinese_memo: My girlfiend saw someone wearing the exact same (duplicate) outfit at a party, so she doubled back to change!
heisig_constituent: duplicate, cloak, fold back, double back, reclining, lying down, sun, day, walking legs
heisig_story: In its original and etymologically transparent sense, to duplicate something means to double it back with a fold, like the fold of a cloak.
koohiiStory1: My girlfiend saw someone wearing the exact same (duplicate) outfit at a party, so she doubled back to change!
koohiiStory2: In Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban, Hermione uses a device called a "time-turner" to double back in time, but this creates duplicates. The smart thing to do would be to combine Hermione´s time-turner with Harry´s invisibility cloak. That way, one could double back in time without creating any visible duplicates.
jp_example_words:
重複(じゅうふく): duplication, repetition, overlapping, redundancy, restoration
複合(ふくごう): composite, complex
複写(ふくしゃ): copy, duplicate
複数(ふくすう): plural, multiple
複雑(ふくざつ): complicated
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Put a spirit in a black hole and a duplicate comes out. The duplicate looks exactly like the original spirit that went in. How strange.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Examine the duplicate spirit. Same ghosty body. Same ghosty glow. A perfect copy.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Suddenly the duplicate spirit starts yelling, "Why did you throw me into that black hole?! F*** (ふく) you!"
WaniKani_Reading_Info: You feel pretty bad now. The duplicate spirit seems to have decided to haunt you, and it's muttering "F*** you, f*** you," over and over in your ear.
Ru_trainchinese: fù: (графема) комплексный, сложный; повторять, дублировать; отплачивать, мстить; поворачиваться; возобновлять; отвечать; снова, опять
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the clothes (衤) for a man to go all day (复) would need to be double
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: My girlfiend saw someone wearing the exact same (duplicate) outfit at a party, so she doubled back to change!
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " clothing " to " re ", the original meaning is " clothing ". "Said Wen": "Heavy clothes. From the clothes, repeat. One said: Chu Yi." "Three Kingdoms·Weizhi·Guan Ning Biography": "I would rather wear soap hats, cloth trousers, and sarongs. complex."

" Re " can mean clothes with cotton wool inside. In the Northern Wei Dynasty Jia Sixie's Qi Min Yaoshu·Miscellaneous Shuo: "In February...the silkworm incident did not start, so people were ordered to sew winter clothes, and they became draped.

" Fu " is also extended to mezzanine. "Old Tang Book-Wang Ji's Biography": "Guangzhi Mansion, please borrow the workshop to benefit from it, and make the cave to restore the wall, and the money is in it."

" Fu " also refers to earth caves. Han Huankuan's "Salt and Iron Theory-Light and Severity": "Summer does not return, winter does not leave the cave."

" Fu " also means many and complicated. The Southern Dynasties Liang Liu Xie's "Wen Xin Diao Long‧ Calligraphy": "Single-complex, those with fat-shaped characters are also...those who are good at writing characters, participate in the military single-fu, and are as good as a pearl." Zhou Zhenfu's note: "Sing-fu, refers to The strokes of the characters are few and many, which makes the characters barren and fat.”
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " clothing ", " re ", the original meaning is " clothing ".
humanum_full_description:
從「衣」，「复」聲，本義為夾衣。《說文》：「重衣皃。从衣，复聲。一曰：褚衣。」《三國志‧魏志‧管寧傳》：「寧常著皁帽、布襦褲、布裙，隨時單複。」

　　「複」可表示內裝棉絮叨衣服。北魏賈思勰《齊民要術‧雜說》：「二月……蠶事未起，命縫人浣冬衣，徹複為袷。」

　　「複」也引申為夾層的。《舊唐書‧王稷傳》：「廣治第宅，嘗奏請藉坊以益之，作複垣洞穴，實金錢於其中。」

　　「複」還指土窟。漢桓寬《鹽鐵論‧輕重》：「夏不失複，冬不離窟。」

　　「複」亦表示繁多、複雜。南朝梁劉勰《文心雕龍‧練字》：「單複者，字形肥瘠者也……善酌字者，參伍單複，磊落如珠矣。」周振甫注：「單複，指字的筆劃少和多，構成字的瘠和肥。」

從「 衣 」，「 复 」聲，本義為夾衣。《說文》：「重衣皃。从衣，复聲。一曰：褚衣。」《三國志‧魏志‧管寧傳》：「寧常著皁帽、布襦褲、布裙，隨時單複。」 「 複 」可表示內裝棉絮叨衣服。北魏賈思勰《齊民要術‧雜說》：「二月……蠶事未起，命縫人浣冬衣，徹複為袷。」 「 複 」也引申為夾層的。《舊唐書‧王稷傳》：「廣治第宅，嘗奏請藉坊以益之，作複垣洞穴，實金錢於其中。」 「 複 」還指土窟。漢桓寬《鹽鐵論‧輕重》：「夏不失複，冬不離窟。」 「 複 」亦表示繁多、複雜。南朝梁劉勰《文心雕龍‧練字》：「單複者，字形肥瘠者也……善酌字者，參伍單複，磊落如珠矣。」周振甫注：「單複，指字的筆劃少和多，構成字的瘠和肥。」
From the sound of " clothing" to " re", the original meaning is " clothing". "Said Wen": "Heavy clothes. From the clothes, repeat. One said: Chu Yi." "Three Kingdoms·Weizhi·Guan Ning Biography": "I would rather wear soap hats, cloth trousers, and sarongs. complex." " Re" can mean clothes with cotton wool inside. In the Northern Wei Dynasty Jia Sixie's Qi Min Yaoshu·Miscellaneous Shuo: "In February...the silkworm incident did not start, so people were ordered to sew winter clothes, and they became draped. " Fu" is also extended to mezzanine. "Old Tang Book-Wang Ji's Biography": "Guangzhi Mansion, please borrow the workshop to benefit from it, and make the cave to restore the wall, and the money is in it." " Fu" also refers to earth caves. Han Huankuan's "Salt and Iron Theory-Light and Severity": "Summer does not return, winter does not leave the cave." " Fu" also means many and complicated. The Southern Dynasties Liang Liu Xie's "Wen Xin Diao Long‧ Calligraphy": "Single-complex, those with fat-shaped characters are also...those who are good at writing characters, participate in the military single-fu, and are as good as a pearl." Zhou Zhenfu's note: "Sing-fu, refers to The strokes of the characters are few and many, which makes the characters barren and fat.”

fù
вм. 复
Radicals: ネ, 复  (spirit, black-hole)
Meaning Mnemonic
Put a spirit in a black hole and a duplicate comes out. The duplicate looks exactly like the original spirit that went in. How strange.
Examine the duplicate spirit. Same ghosty body. Same ghosty glow. A perfect copy.
Reading Mnemonic
Suddenly the duplicate spirit starts yelling, "Why did you throw me into that black hole?! F*** (ふく) you!"
You feel pretty bad now. The duplicate spirit seems to have decided to haunt you, and it's muttering "F*** you, f*** you," over and over in your ear.
